title: 35 injured in clash between 2 groups of villagers
body: At least 35 people were injured in a clash between two groups of villagers over establishing dominance in Kullia village of Magura Sadar Upazila on Friday. According to the local people, a long-standing dispute between supporters of Azhar Ali, a member of Ward 7 of Kuchiamora Union, and Bakul Member has been going on over establishing dominance. Following this, a clash occurred between the groups at about 10:00am. The police reached the spot after receiving information about the clash but failed to immediately bring the situation under control, and later, joint forces joined in and together they were able to stop the clash. Magura Sadar police station officer-in-charge Md Ayub Ali said that on information, the police quickly went to the scene. ‘The situation is currently under control and additional police have been deployed in the area,’ he said. Although no case has been filed in the incident yet, an investigation was under way, added the police official. Magura 250-bedded Hospital’s doctor, Md Mamun ur Rashid said that about 35 injured patients came to the hospital for treatment in the morning. ‘However, there were no signs of serious injuries on anyone’s body. All received treatment and were out of danger,’ he added.
